net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.api

Interface SearchIndexer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, Flushable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSearchIndexer, LuceneSearchIndexer

    public interface SearchIndexer
extends Flushable, Closeable
    This is the interface for the indexer used to create and modify a search index. After a search-index is created, the contained information can be searched and found via a SearchEngine.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    SearchIndexerBuilder

      This method adds the given entry to the search-index.

      This method closes the search index.

    • Method Detail

      • createEntry

        MutableSearchEntry createEntry()
        This method creates a new and empty entry for the search-index. After the entry is filled with data, use add(MutableSearchEntry) to add it to the search index.
        Returns:
        a new and empty search-index entry.

      • add

        void add(MutableSearchEntry entry)
  throws SearchException
        This method adds the given entry to the search-index.
        Parameters:
        entry - is the entry to add.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • update

        int update(MutableSearchEntry entry)
    throws SearchException
        This method updates the given entry in the search-index. This method will use the property SearchEntry.FIELD_CUSTOM_ID to identify a potentially existing entry to update. Otherwise it will use a combination of SearchEntry.FIELD_URI and SearchEntry.FIELD_SOURCE as identifier (what is NOT a very strong ID as the URI can change).
        Parameters:
        entry - is the entry to update.
        Returns:
        the number of entries that have been replaced. This should typically be 1 if one entry was replaced or 0 none was replaced and the given entry has only been added. A value greater than 1 indicates that multiple entries have been replaced that all have the same identifier what indicates a mistake of your index or the indexer.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • removeById

        boolean removeById(Long entryId)
            throws SearchException
        This method removes an existing entry identified by the given id from the search-index.
        ATTENTION:
        If you are using lucene as implementation according to some questionable design of lucene this method has to close the IndexWriter and create an IndexReader to perform the delete. If you invoke an other method after that the same has to be done reverse. This can cause really bad performance.
        Parameters:
        entryId - is the ID of the entry to remove (NOT null).
        Returns:
        true if the entry existed and has been removed from the index, false if NO entry exists for the given id.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • remove

        boolean remove(SearchHit hit)
        throws SearchException
        This method removes an existing entry identified by the given hit. In most cases this method will delegate to removeById(Long). However the implementation can decide what is the best way to do it.
        Parameters:
        hit - is the SearchHit to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the entry existed and has been removed from the index, false if NO entry exists for the given hit.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • removeByCustumId

        int removeByCustumId(String cid)
              throws SearchException
        This method removes an existing entry identified by the given uri from the search-index.
        Parameters:
        cid - is the custom-ID of an entry previously added to the index.
        Returns:
        the number of entries that have been removed. This should typically be 1 if one entry exists with the given uid or 0 if no such entry exists. A value greater than 1 indicates that multiple entries have been removed that all have the given uid what indicates a mistake of your index(er). A value of -1 means the number is unknown because this is not supported by the implementation.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.
        See Also:
        update(MutableSearchEntry)

      • removeByUri

        int removeByUri(String uri,
                String sourceId)
         throws SearchException
        This method removes an existing entry identified by the given uri from the search-index.
        Parameters:
        uri - is the URI of an entry previously added to the index.
        sourceId - is the ID of the SearchSource. This is required because the uri itself may NOT be unique (e.g. different sources might both contain the entry with URI "index.html").
        Returns:
        the number of entries that have been removed. This should typically be 1 if one entry exists with the given uri or 0 if no such entry exists. A value greater than 1 indicates that multiple entries have been removed that all have the given uri. A value of -1 means the number is unknown because this is not supported by the implementation.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.
        See Also:
        update(MutableSearchEntry)

      • remove

        int remove(String field,
           Object value)
    throws SearchException
        This method removes all existing entries identified by the given value at the given property from the search-index.
        ATTENTION:
        Please use this method with care.
        Parameters:
        field - is the name of the field where the value is expected to occur. Therefore the field should NOT to be of the type SearchFieldType.TEXT.
        value - is the value of the field.
        Returns:
        the number of entries that have been removed or -1 if the number is unknown because this is not supported by the implementation.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • flush

        void flush()
    throws SearchException
        This method flushes the search index what ensures that all changes are written to the index. If NOT supported by the implementation, this method will have no effect.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface Flushable
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • optimize

        void optimize()
       throws SearchException
        This method optimizes the search index. If NOT supported by the implementation, this method will have no effect. Optimization will typically cause some performance overhead but therefore speed up your searches.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • getSearchEngine

        SearchEngine getSearchEngine()
        This method gets the SearchEngine for the index of this SearchIndexer. It may be used for advanced indexing where search-queries need to performed for updating the search-index.
        Returns:
        the SearchEngine.

      • close

        void close()
    throws SearchException
        This method closes the search index. After the call of this method no other method of this object shall be invoked.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.
